Simple in mechanics and much more fun of playing it. It seems that Valve developers had a lot of amusement  by constructing complicated levels which we had to complete by creating two types of portals (blue & orange in. in & out exit). Your imagination, clever and smart approch will be compulsory to finish the game. During the playthrough you will by accompanied by funny and not serious narration and story in the background but I ensure You it will be a lot of fun. Sometimes not complexed game proves that are not easy as they seems. It is really worth to try ! 

Highly recommend !

If you haven't played the Portal games yet definitely give them some consideration. The first one is a bit short but it is still a lot of fun and well worth the time to play. You can find it bundled with Portal 2 and the bundle often goes on sale for just a few bucks. Almost everyone I know who's played these games has loved them. I really hope Valve decides to make more of these games at some point.

11/10
i like it

This game is a 9/10 puzzle game, easily one of the best I've ever played. Nearly everything that has been said about the game has been: It's world, character, and iconic gimmick of Portals (roll credits).

However, the best part of this game is how it lets the player find A solution, not THE solution. I found myself doing things the dumbest way possible with a lot of these puzzles, and it all still worked out due to the open-ended design. Going through the advanced challenges of reinventing solutions to old puzzles to do it the fastest, or with the least portals, lead to me finding various solutions that never crossed my mind. And Portal lets you do all of them.

If there's one flaw, it's the padding between Chamber 19 and the fight with GLADoS. At that point, I was ready to confront the final boss, but instead I spent an hour or so walking around solving "puzzles." Admittedly, seeing the puzzle rooms from the other side of the glass and seeing a few new mechanics, but the whole sequence could have been shortened immensely.

But that's just a small footnote compared to how incredible and charming the rest of this game is. If you haven't played it, buy it right now. You won't regret it.

The puzzles are both easy enough to solve without tearing out your hair while also being challenging enough to be satisfying when you complete them. And there's Advanced Challenges to move on to when you've done the ordinary ones - which really helps, because without them I'm not sure I would've been able to recommend it. The main sequence is over pretty quickly, and make for a pretty short game, so the Advanced chambers add a lot to it.
